what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: {oncokbR} allows annotate genomic data sets using MSK’s OncoKB Precision Oncology Knowledge Base directly R. package wraps existing OncoKB API endpoints R users can easily leverage existing API annotate data mutations, copy number alterations fusions. package compatible oncoKB data v3.16, subject change new versions released. information oncoKB, see [Chakravarty et al. 2017[(https://ascopubs.org/doi/full/10.1200/PO.17.00011). Gao et al. Sci. Signal. 2013 Cerami et al. Cancer Discov. 2012

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version oncokbR like :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Annotate MAF data tumor type indicated annotations oncogenicity oncoKB treatment levels: can also annotated tumor type data oncogenicity :
code: library(oncokbR) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union blca_mutation <- oncokbR::blca_mutation %>%   mutate(tumor_type = "BLCA")  annotated_tt <- annotate_mutations(mutations = blca_mutation[1:50,])  annotated_tt %>%   select(oncogenic) %>%    table() #> oncogenic #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                4                1               45 annotated_tt %>%   select(treatments_level ) %>%    table() #> treatments_level #> LEVEL_3B  #>        1 blca_mutation <- oncokbR::blca_mutation  annotated_no_tt <- annotate_mutations(mutations = blca_mutation[1:50,]) #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.  annotated_no_tt %>%   select(oncogenic) %>% table() #> oncogenic #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                4                1               45

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: blca_cna <- blca_cna %>%   mutate(tumor_type = "BLCA")   annotated <- annotate_cna(blca_cna[1:10,]) table(annotated$oncogenic) #>  #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                3                6                1

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: blca_sv <- blca_sv %>%   mutate(tumor_type = "BLCA")   annotated <- annotate_sv(blca_sv[1:10,]) table(annotated$oncogenic) #>  #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                6                3                1

Annotate CNA — annotate_cna
text: cna cna file long format (similar maf file)

title: Annotate Mutations — annotate_mutations
text: Annotate maf maf-like files using information protein change HGVSg. can annotated tumor types indicated (oncotree codes), without.

title: Annotate Mutations — annotate_mutations
text: mutations mutations file MAF, similar format annotate_by Can indicate whether annotate "protein_change" "hgvsg (see oncoKB API docs info). none specified, guess made according columns data.

title: Annotate Mutations — annotate_mutations
code: mutations <- oncokbR::blca_mutation[1:10, ]  # Annotate without tumor type ----- x <- annotate_mutations(mutations) #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.  # Annotate with tumor type ----- mutations$tumor_type = "BLCA" y <- annotate_mutations(mutations)  # Annotate by HGVSg z <- annotate_mutations(oncokbR::mutations_hgvsg) #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.

title: Annotate Structural Variants — annotate_sv
text: sv cna file long format (similar maf file)

title: Annotate Structural Variants — annotate_sv
code: sv <- blca_sv[1:10,]  x <- annotate_sv(sv = sv) #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.
